chargeHist.descr: Possess Methamphetamine w/ Intent to deliver as repeater (<=3g)
Possess Methamphetamine w/ Intent to deliver, second and subsequent offense (<=3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. DVORAK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine with Intent to deliver(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after two years of initial confinement.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph A. DVORAK
Current: 2000 Johnston Drive #71, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 09-10-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States
At 10:37 a.m., $500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Amended Criminal Complaint filed amending Count 1 removing repeater and adding second and subsequent offense.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 09-25-15 at 2:15 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Defendant has already posted $1,200.00 cash in his other files.  Attorney Kolell requests either a signature bond or a lower cash bail of $300 to $400 and also requests a furlough to allow him time to go to the credit union to withdraw the money.  State objects to both motions.  Court denies motion for bail modification and motion for furlough.
Minutes.
Matthew Kolell, through public defender.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver as repeater, on 08-17-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver, possess prescription drugs with intent to deliver and 3 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
